Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s Night Of The Living Dead from back in 1968 proved that there was a market for zombie-themed exploitation films, but it would be plenty of years before more cinematic undead crawlers would transform our most beloved pastime onto film.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely related to an unseen creature from thousands and thousands of years ago. While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, Jerry MEA Culpa falls off a building trying to prove his super-sized ego. Meanwhile, Tom picks up stray kittens from around town so he can cash in on government food subsidies for cut developmentally disabled children.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to be criticized by some because it has very little action and that the acting is somewhat below average, and if you're one of those people, I would respond by saying you probably won't greatly appreciate a movie that's low on gore and high on comedy.
